title: 820-00034-A 2 led on, fan on, no chime/screen
message: what lines can affect the #2 led?

title: 820-00034-A 2 led on, fan on, no chime/screen
message: It is controlled by ALL_SYS_PWRGD, which is created from the power good signals of various power supplies.

title: 820-00034-A 2 led on, fan on, no chime/screen
message:
PM_SLP_S5_L 0v can be the problem?
i dont find the problem..

title: 820-00034-A 2 led on, fan on, no chime/screen
message:
ALL_SYS_PWRGD requires various voltages, from S3 and even S0 state.

If PM_SLP_S4_L pulses (when trigger SMC_ONOFF_L), then S3 voltages must pulse too.
If first LED (S5) goes off/on when trigger SMC_ONOFF_L, SMC may detect some short/overcurrent on a secondary power supply.

title: 820-00034-A 2 led on, fan on, no chime/screen
message:
i have just the s5(pp3v3-pp5v..) voltage, other V rails are 0v, no shorts on the rails..
what produce the other voltage?

title: 820-00034-A 2 led on, fan on, no chime/screen
message:
If S5 voltageas are steady, first LED must not blink.
S3 voltages may try to appear [B][U]IF[/U][/B] PM_SLP_S4_L pulses; you must check them for pulse at same time.

title: 820-00034-A 2 led on, fan on, no chime/screen
message:
S5 and 1st led are stable until I’m press the power button, then when I leave the power button the led shut off for 1sec and on again.
Pulse when I trigger power button?

title: 820-00034-A 2 led on, fan on, no chime/screen
message:
If LED1 blinks, then S5 state is not stable.
Check for drop pulse at 12V_S5 and 3V3_S5, when pressing power button.
Use J5120 pads, instead of power button.

Be sure 12V_G3H is steady, not pulsing.

title: 820-00034-A 2 led on, fan on, no chime/screen

[/QUOTE]
they both drop pulse when i pressing(release) the power button.
12V_G3H 13v stable

title: 820-00034-A 2 led on, fan on, no chime/screen
message:
You've said to had steady 3V3_S5; why did you change Q7610 then?
Is not possible to get correct L7610 voltage, if Q7610 was bad.
Good 3V3_S5 implies P12V_S5 was also good.
Now you lost 12V_S5; not sure what you did...

title: 820-00034-A 2 led on, fan on, no chime/screen
message:
NEVER touch the pins to mmeasure voltage on QFN chips?
Use surrounding components as test points.

You've made short between some U7600 pins and Q7610 got burnt.
Now U7600 is probably damaged; maybe other adjacent components too.
